Authors: Dennis E Desjardin, Don E. Hemmes, Brian Andrew Perry
Title:
A ruby-colored Pseudobaeospora species is described as new
from material collected on Hawai`i island
Keywords: Alien Wet Forest, Hawaiian mycota, taxonomy
Abstract:
Pseudobaeospora wipapatiae is described as new based on
material collected in Alien Wet habitats on the island of Hawai`i.
Unique features of this beautiful species include deep ruby-colored
basidiomes with 2-spored basidia, amyloid cheilocystidia, and a
hymeniderm pileipellis with abundant pileocystidia that is initially
deep ruby in KOH then changes to lilac grey. Phylogenetic analyses of
nuclear large ribosomal subunit sequence data confirm placement of the
novel taxon within Pseudobaeospora, and suggest a close relationship of
this genus with Tricholoma. A comprehensive description, color
photograph, illustrations of salient micromorphological features, and
comparisons with phenetically similar taxa are provided.
